DOC.brief_title: Seasonal Influenza Vaccine , Quadrivalent Versus Trivalent Patients With Advanced Chronic Obstructive Pulmonary Disease
DOC.detailed_description: Primary Objectives : To evaluate magnitude humoral immune response quadrivalent vs trivalent influenza vaccine adult age 50 64 year prior diagnosis GOLD Stage C D COPD ( vs. patient without COPD ) . To demonstrate immunogenicity measure hemagglutination inhibit antibody ( HI ) components viral antigen use seroconversion ( ≥4 fold increase baseline titer ) sero-protection ( HI titer ≥40 vaccine component ) . Secondary Objective : To assess degree antibody response COPD patient base severity disease measure FEV1 . To assess impact inhaled corticosteroid adaptive immune response vaccination .
DOC.criteria: Inclusion criterion patient COPD : 1 . Signed informed consent prior initiation studymandated vaccination . 2 . Patients spirometric data precede 18 month confirm diagnosis COPD . 3 . Patients meet GOLD Classification Stage C Stage D COPD . 4 . Patients 50 year old 64 year old . Inclusion criterion Healthy participant : 1 . Signed informed consent prior initiation studymandated vaccination . 2 . No active symptom lung disease . 3 . FEV1/FVC normal range > 70 % age predict value . 4 . No history tobacco use/abuse . 5 . No prior history alpha1 antitrypsin deficiency . 6 . Patients 50 year old 64 year old . 1 . Severe allergy egg . 2 . Severe reaction past dos influenza vaccine . 3 . GuillianBarre syndrome . 4 . Currently recieving dialysis . 5 . Current , active , treatment cancer . 6 . History transplant ( allograft ) . 7 . Dementia Alzheimer 's disease diagnosis . 8 . Prior diagnosis HIV AIDS . 9 . Moderate severe pulmonary hypertension . 10 . Serum AST/ALT > 3x upper limit normal . 11 . Patients exacerbation respiratory infection 4 week precede onset study . 12 . Active pregnancy . 13 . Systemic immunomodulating medication .
